column1: UPDATE 1-Indian court refuses to lift deadline for Kotak Mahindra stake dilution - TV
column2: Kotak Mahindra Bank surges on report of likely Berkshire investment
column3: Kotak Mahindra Bank jumps on report of Berkshire investment
column4: Kotak Mahindra Bank challenges RBI decision on preference shares
column5: Nifty, Sensex rise; Kotak Mahindra Bank sees best day in nearly 9 years
column6: High Court refuses to stay deadline for Kotak Mahindra Bank stake dilution: CNBC TV18
column7: Deals of the day-Mergers and acquisitions
column8: Expert Views: In surprise move, RBI Governor Urjit Patel steps down
column10: Indian shares rise; Kotak Mahindra Bank sees best day in nearly 9 yrs
column11: Indian shares rise; Kotak Mahindra Bank sees best day in nearly 9 yrs

column1: An Indian court refused to stay the central bank order forcing Kotak Mahindra Bank Chief Executive Uday Kotak to dilute his stake in the company he founded, news channel CNBC TV18 reported on Monday, sending shares of the lender sliding nearly 4 percent.
column2: Shares of India's Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd posted their sharpest surge in nearly nine years on Friday following a report that billionaire investor Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc is planning to pick up a 10 percent stake in the bank.
column3: Shares of India's Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd jumped as much as 8 percent on Friday after CNBC-TV18 reported that Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc is planning to invest about $4 billion to $6 billion in the bank.
column4: Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd said on Monday it had challenged in court the central bank's decision to not allow its promoter to issue preference shares to reduce stake in the private-sector lender.
column5: Indian shares edged up on Friday, recovering from sharp losses in the previous session, boosted by a report that Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc might take a stake in private-sector lender Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd.
column6: Bombay High Court refused to stay the central bank's decision to not allow promoter stake sale in Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd and said it would hear the case next on January 17, news channel CNBC TV18 reported on Monday.
column7: The following bids, mergers, acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2100 GMT on Friday:
column8: The Reserve Bank of India's Governor, Urjit Patel, resigned for "personal reasons" on Monday, a decision analysts linked to the intense pressure on the central bank from the government to ease regulatory curbs.
